title: The Last marsh
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Urbanization - Environmental aspects
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Wildlife conservation
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Marsh ecology
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Environmental education
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Conservation of natural resources
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Photography - Social aspects
description: A photographic record of one of the last great urban marshes, the Powderhorn Marsh, filled in 1968 to constitute an urban intersection in Chicago. The destruction of the marsh raises many ecological questions. Must encroaching urbanisation continue to disrupt natural wildlife preserves?
